strings: <se_low>King Trode: Somehow the power of the magic circle protected Medea and I from the thorns.

<se_low>King Trode: But all my loyal servants... Well, you can see what a terrible fate has befallen them.
I suppose I should be thankful they weren't killed.
<se_low>King Trode: Aaaah... It's utterly heart-wrenching.

<se_high>Jessica: Dhoulmagus did this to the castle!?
All by himself?
I had no idea he was that strong!
<se_high>Jessica: Are we really going to be able to beat someone like that? Even with a ship...?

<se_high>Jessica: Sorry. Forget it.
I won't talk like that again.

<se_high>Jessica: Let's be careful.
Those thorns certainly look sharp.
I get nervous just walking around here.
<se_low>Yangus: Just lookin' at all them spiky thorns makes me go prickly all over. It 'urts!
<se_low>Yangus: Ow! Ouch!
<se_def>Angelo: I know a prayer isn't going to do much to help these people, but at least it eases my conscience.

<se_low>King Trode: For heaven's sake, <leader>!
Is this really the time to be having a chinwag, hm!? Look!

<se_low>King Trode: It's the Goddess, or rather the moon, giving us guidance.
You'll miss it if you're chitter-chattering!
<se_high>Jessica: Look at that window-frame pattern on the wall over there! Doesn't it remind you of the one we saw in Ascantha? But why here and now?

<se_low>Yangus: Crikey! It's night-time already?
That came a bit quick, didn't it?
Nice breeze though, eh?

<se_low>Yangus: An' there's a good moon tonight.
Might even be full.
<se_def>Angelo: An inconceivable ship in an equally inconceivable place. And now, a Moonshadow window in a cursed castle smothered in thorns.
<se_def>Angelo: It sounds just like a fairy tale, but I suppose I could get on board with it.
<se_low>King Trode: I'm more than familiar with the contents of the Trodain vault, and there's nothing called a Moonshadow harp in there, I can assure you.
<se_low>King Trode: So let's look somewhere else, shall we, <leader>!?
<se_high>Jessica: I thought we established that the Moonshadow harp isn't here.
<se_high>Jessica: If you want to poke around again, that's your prerogative. But I'm telling you, you're wasting time.
<se_low>Yangus: Argh!
<se_low>Yangus: I, I just got one o' them thorns in me toe!
<se_def>Angelo: Come on! It'd be a bit too easy if the Moonshadow harp was around here, don't you think?
<se_def>Angelo: I won't stop you if you're determined to look, but it's a waste of time if you ask me.
<se_high>Jessica: Sounds like the thief who stole the Moonshadow harp is somewhere beyond that tunnel we saw in Ascantha Castle.
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better hurry up and give chase before it's too late! Come on!
<se_high>Jessica: They're pretty strong for a bunch of moles! This is crazy!

<se_high>Jessica: We can't let them beat us.
Let's go back and show them what we're really made of!
<se_low>Yangus: There's this place north of Ascantha surrounded by mountains. The only way to get there's by diggin' an 'ole.
<se_low>Yangus: Not a bad place for a thief's 'ideout, I reckon. Maybe that's where the geezer who stole the Moonshadow 'arp is.
<se_low>Yangus: Let's get a move on back to Ascantha Castle!
<se_low>Yangus: We ain't lettin' them moles keep the Moonshadow 'arp!
<se_low>Yangus: Moles... I dunno!
<se_low>Yangus: Just thinkin' about that awful racket the fat one made is enough to bring me dinner back up! Uuurgh!
<se_def>Angelo: I know the King said he'd summon his men and all that...

<se_def>Angelo: But it's King Pavan, right?
Hardly the most dynamic person we've ever met.
We'd better take care of this ourselves.
<se_def>Angelo: These moles won't get the better of us. Right?
<se_def>Angelo: We'd better make sure we show them who's boss this time, or we'll never live it down!
<se_low>King Trode: I shan't be returning here again until we've defeated Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>King Trode: Be strong without your King, my dear castle.
And my beloved people, fare thee well.
I will be back as soon as possible.
<se_high>Jessica: The castle and servants are still covered in thorns...

<se_high>Jessica: We've got to put things right.
And the only way to do that is by defeating Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>Yangus: That bloke through the Moonshadow window's a bit of a myst'ry, ain't 'e?

<se_low>Yangus: First we find 'im in Ascantha, an' then we bump into 'im again in the library in Grandad's castle.<page>Yangus: I s'pose it's more of a myst'ry wot I was doin' in a library though, eh!?
<se_def>Angelo: Can't we get going? I'm not saying anything about our wonderful King, but his castle full of creepers is giving me the creeps!
<se_low>King Trode: If my ancestors hadn't recorded those details about the wasteland where we found the ship, we'd still be without it.

<se_low>King Trode: I thank you, former kings of Trodain!
And pray for your strength.
<se_low>King Trode: Help us to defeat that wicked fiend, Dhoulmagus, who's brought such misery to our great kingdom. ...And to the whole world.
<se_high>Jessica: I hate to sound callous, but there's nothing we can do for these people right now.

<se_high>Jessica: Let's take the ship west.
It's high time we took care of Dhoulmagus.

<se_low>Yangus: So this old dump was a knockout castle once, eh?
I can't really picture it meself.
<se_low>Yangus: That curse Dhoulmagus put on it must o' been pretty bloomin' fruity.
<se_def>Angelo: Wouldn't we be better off trying to move ahead rather than indulging in pointless sentimentality? We've a jester to apprehend, remember?

<se_low>King Trode: Ah, my castle was so magnificent!
My Medea so beautiful!
<se_low>King Trode: But for Dhoulmagus! Dhoulmagus's curse took it all away from me!<page>King Trode: I will not rest until that wretched grinner has been held to account for his innumerable crimes!
<se_high>Princess Medea: ...Neigh.

<se_low>King Trode: Oh, my poor Medea!
Don't worry, my dear.
You will be beautiful again!

<se_low>King Trode: So then. Shall we depart?
There's no point staring at the place all day long.
<se_low>King Trode: We can do nothing to help my poor people or my castle at the moment.

<se_high>Jessica: Only you could sink so low, Dhoulmagus...
Subjecting innocent people to such misery!

<se_high>Jessica: We have to take care of him once and for all.
We can't let him get away with this any more!

<se_low>Yangus: I don't like it when people rabbit on an' on for ages. I can't follow wot they're sayin'.<page>Yangus: But I got this much.
You're somefin' really special, guv!

<se_def>Angelo: Come on, <hero>! Let's go!
You and King Trode aren't with it at all, are you?

<se_def>Angelo: But we should be careful. I'm still getting a bad feeling from this castle.
There are monsters about. I can smell them.

<se_low>King Trode: What are you doing!?
You're supposed to be finding the book about the ship!
<se_high>Jessica: It's almost a relief to come across a room without any victims in it.

<se_high>Jessica: I don't mean to sound disrespectful.
It's just that it's hard to take after a while.
Come on, let's find the book.
<se_low>Yangus: ...F, G, ', I, J, K, L, M... M...

<se_low>Yangus: Well that's bloomin' odd!
There ain't no book called ‘Magical Ships’.

<se_def>Angelo: I'll take this section.
You cover the rest, all right?
<se_low>King Trode: So the wasteland where the ship now rests was once covered by sea, a long, long time ago. Well, that makes sense.

<se_low>King Trode: But the place is full of sand and rocks now.
Surely it'll be quite impossible to move the vessel.

<se_high>Jessica: So you're good at finding things, too, <hero>!
You're a man of many talents...
<se_low>Yangus: Arrrrgh!

<se_low>Yangus: Lookin' at all them letters is doin' me nut!
I can't take it no more!
I'm gonna pop me clogs!
<se_low>Yangus: This is Grandad's kind o' thing, this, not mine!
<se_def>Angelo: Just because the wasteland was sea before, we can't turn back time, can we? The sea's gone for good now, and maybe this castle has, too.
<se_def>Angelo: Coming to the library here was a waste of time.

<se_low>Yangus: We better stop windin' Grandad up.
Let's go somewhere else, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: If old Prince Charmless asks us wot this place is, we won't know wot to tell 'im, will we?
<se_high>Jessica: As far as Charmless knows, Princess Medea is living here in Trodain, happily counting the days until the wedding ceremony, right?
<se_high>Jessica: Won't it cause a big stink if he realises what happened to the castle?

<se_def>Angelo: What are we doing here!?
Why come to Trodain?
<se_def>Angelo: What if Charmles starts asking questions? Just don't let on where we are, all right?
<se_low>Yangus: If we go back to Argonia, we can get rid o' the Prince.
<se_low>Yangus: It's a bit late to say it now, I know, but we can come 'ere after we've dropped 'im off.
<se_high>Jessica: Look, just a little longer and we can bid farewell to Charmless without him being any the wiser about Trodain.
<se_high>Jessica: So isn't this the last place on earth we should be taking him? What are you going to do if he wants to know about the castle, idiot?
<se_def>Angelo: If Charmles finds out that the castle here is Trodain Castle, the whole wedding business will be out of the window.<page>Angelo: There'll be no white dress for the Princess.

<se_def>Angelo: I don't know what old Trode thinks about that, but personally I think it'd be no bad thing.
For the Princess's sake.

<se_low>King Trode: You know what to do!
Or rather, what NOT to do, hm!?
Do not say a word!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hm!? Say a word about what?
Come along! Speak up, driver!
<se_low>King Trode: Er...Do not say a word...against you...Your Highness. Yes! That's what I meant.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hmph! I hardly think anyone here would have anything unfavourable to say about me!

<se_low>King Trode: We've no business here, <leader>!
HM!? We must leave AT ONCE! HM!?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: What a revolting castle!
It looks like a pigsty!
Surely no one lives here!?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Clearly the King must be an utter fool, allowing his castle to fall into such appalling disrepair!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: But it's rather intriguing.
I should like to meet this moronic king and find out just how dim-witted he really is.
<se_low>Yangus: I don't reckon we should 'ang about 'ere.

<se_low>Yangus: Can't say why, but y'know... Eh?
Nudge, nudge!
<se_high>Jessica: Why, why, why did you bring us here?
<se_high>Jessica: Have you forgotten who's with us?

<se_def>Angelo: Oh, come on!
What are we going to talk about here?
Landscape gardening!? Romantic ruins!?<page>Angelo: Or perhaps a ‘thornier’ topic!?
Like international relations!?

<se_def>Angelo: Let's just save the chat, and leave.
Sound good to you?

<se_low>King Trode: You know what to do!
Or rather, what NOT to do, hm!?
Do not say a word!

<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hm!? Say a word about what?
Come along! Speak up, driver!
<se_low>King Trode: Er...Do not say a word...against you...Your Highness. Yes! That's what I meant.
<se_def>Prince Charmles: Hmph! I hardly think anyone here would have anything unfavourable to say about me!
<se_low>King Trode: We don't have any business here, do we, <leader>?
<se_low>King Trode: We have the Argon heart now, so surely Argonia should be our next destination, no?

<se_def>Prince Charmles: I've completed the initiation now.
All that remains is for you to escort me back to Argonia.<page>Prince Charmles: Why have you brought me to this dilapidated old ruin!?
<se_def>Prince Charmles: It looks like it was a castle once, but surely no one lives here now?
<se_low>Yangus: We can't show the Prince 'round this dirty old place!

<se_low>Yangus: His 'Ighness might catch somefin' in a filthy dump like wot we 'ave accidentally arrived at 'ere!<page>Yangus: Best not to linger in this vinicity!
Wot, wot!?
<se_low>King Trode: Grrrr...
<se_high>Jessica: We'd better get out of here before the Prince starts poking around.

<se_def>Angelo: Oh, come on!
What are we going to talk about here?
Landscape gardening!? Romantic ruins!?<page>Angelo: Or perhaps a ‘thornier’ topic!?
Like international relations!?

<se_def>Angelo: Let's just save the chat, and leave.
Sound good to you?
